entry.title: My favorite Makefile for LaTeX
entry.summary: Finally, my search for a good Makefile for LaTeX  document writing  was ended by this solution. You may have heard about latex-makefile or latex-mk or other LaTeX makefiles. But either they are too complicated, dependent on other external programs, need to install before use or not  powerful enough to get the most jobs done. Here, this latex-makefile is light-weight, self-contained, zero-dependent and powerful to deal with most cases. Simply download it, drop into the same directory with your LaTeX source file and you are ready to go. Its colorful output really makes error-checking much easier. I like it very much. Highly recommend it.

entry.title: tlmgr is better than those provided by Linux distribution
entry.summary: Even though many Linux distributions have provided TeX packages, I still like  tlmgr to manage everything. It is like apt-get but just for TeX Live. Management and configuration become much more convenient.

entry.title: Latex \cite{} tolerate white spaces?
entry.summary:
To make latex/bibtex tolerate the white spaces in your long \cite{foooooo, baaaaaar, loooooooog}, use package 'cite'

\usepackage{cite}

entry.title: Check syntax error of latex file with lacheck
entry.summary: Before you make a long wait compilation of your latex file, you can use lacheck to check the syntax error first. lacheck is probably already packaged within your tex installation.
